body:
When I run `git commit`, the command will call pre-commit hooks but sometimes it fails.  It shows `Timed out waiting for etcd`, but actually I can see the etcd running by `ps -ef | grep etcd`. Finally I find that I forget to set `export no_proxy` for localhost. (My building env is behind proxy, so I have to set http_proxy/https_proxy for internet connection).

Do we need to set `export no_proxy=127.0.0.1,localhost` in the building scripts? If so, it would bring some convenience for developers who are behind proxy.

I modify the `init.sh` [like this](https://github.com/xiangpengzhao/kubernetes/commit/6d2b72d3b9e7345a546fd238c78033cc0737f2dd),  it can work.

hi @thockin , sorry to bother you, would you please check this? Thanks! If it's OK, I will create a PR.

```
Checking for swagger spec that need updating... !!! [0524 10:03:05] Timed out waiting for etcd:  to answer at http://127.0.0.1:4001/v2/machines; tried 80 waiting 0.25 between each
!!! Error in /home/paas/zxp/code/k8s/fork2/kubernetes/hack/lib/etcd.sh:42
  'return 1' exited with status 1
Call stack:
  1: /home/paas/zxp/code/k8s/fork2/kubernetes/hack/lib/etcd.sh:42 kube::etcd::start(...)
  2: /home/paas/zxp/code/k8s/fork2/kubernetes/hack/update-swagger-spec.sh:60 main(...)
Exiting with status 1
!!! Error in hack/verify-swagger-spec.sh:37
  '"${KUBE_ROOT}/hack/update-swagger-spec.sh"' exited with status 1
Call stack:
  1: hack/verify-swagger-spec.sh:37 main(...)
Exiting with status 1
ERROR!
```
title: Need to export no_proxy in the building scripts ?
